Progress Bar examples - Going in all directions

An assortment of ProgressBars, each going in a different direction, all accelerated.

The four bars above were created with the following code:

They are rendered into divs with their ids set to the direction of the bar each will contain. The movement of the bars is produced by the following code:

None of this code deals with switching the background from a rippling one when it is moving to a solid one when is at rest. The ProgressBar adds a .yui-pb-anim class name to the bar when it is being animated, which helps us switch the background:

The ProgressBar also adds a class name signaling the direction the bar will move, which allows us to use a background with the ripples going in the right direction. These background images are not animated by themselves, they are not animated GIFs or such, the ProgressBar offsets those images by using the background-position CSS attribute, which lets us control speed and direction, and lets them repeat.
